mainEntity.name: What is Btracking’s LoRa Yard Management System?

acceptedAnswer.text: The LoRa Yard Management System uses long-range wireless tags and base stations to provide real-time location tracking for assets within a local area, such as a yard, port, warehouse, or campus.

mainEntity.name: How does the system track assets?

acceptedAnswer.text: Each asset is fitted with a LoRa GPS tag, which transmits its location to nearby base stations using long-range WiFi. The base stations then forward this data to the Btracking platform for live location monitoring.

mainEntity.name: What types of assets can I track with LoRa tags?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can track forklifts, pallets, trailers, cranes, baggage carts, and other mobile equipment within a facility. It’s ideal for any non-road asset that stays within a defined area.
The system provides near real-time visibility and exact GPS locations when used in conjunction with properly placed base stations, spaced about ½ mile apart.

mainEntity.name: How far can LoRa tags communicate with base stations?

acceptedAnswer.text: LoRa tags can typically communicate up to ½ mile to a base station, depending on the layout and environment of your facility. You can expand coverage by adding more base stations.

mainEntity.name: Are the tags and base stations solar powered?

acceptedAnswer.text: Btracking offers both solar rechargeable, and rechargeable battery powered LoRa tags. Base stations require power, and have a solar panel for emergency backup.

mainEntity.name: Does the system support temperature monitoring?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. Optional LoRa temperature sensors can be added to monitor environmental conditions, with instant alerts if temperatures fall outside your preset thresholds.
